availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Monroe Williamson (Caldwell co. farm laborer and corp. 15th ky cav)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier. Tennessee native. Son of Austin Williamson and Elizabeth Phelps Williamson. Student in Wilson County, Tennessee, in 1850. EFarm laborer in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 15th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a corporal from March 11, 1863, to October 6, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Wilson County, District 14, p. 552A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Farmersville, p. 147.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0136.
